block-definition.s: generate text with stored api key %'prompt'
block-definition.comment: Generate text with GPT-3! You need to set the browser db key "openaiapikey" to your OpenAI API Key for this to work. The input must be the prompt.

custom-block.s: complete %s using key %s %br maximum token length %n %br using engine named %txt %br stop completing before generating %txt %br with temperature %n %br with top-p %n %br presence penalty %n %br with frequency penalty %n

block-definition.s: complete %'prompt' using key %'api key' $nl maximum token length %'token length' $nl using engine named %'engine' $nl stop completing before generating %'stop sequences' $nl with temperature %'temperature' $nl with top-p %'top p' $nl presence penalty %'prescence penalty' $nl with frequency penalty %'frequency penalty'
block-definition.comment: Use GPT-3 to generate text! Input 2 must be your OpenAI API key which you can obtain from https://openai.com For documentation on the inputs see https://beta.openai.com/docs/api-reference/completions/c

block-definition.translations: pt:a resposta a _ de _ enviando _ e cabeçalhos _

block-definition.s: generate text with stored api key and raw data %'prompt'

block.l: This program only works if you have an API key from OpenAI. If you have looked at the script to see that your key is safe then enter your key. If you need a key visit openai.com
No speech heard for a while.

custom-block.s: complete %s using key %s %br maximum token length %n %br using engine named %txt %br stop completing before generating %txt %br with temperature %n %br with top-p %n %br presence penalty %n %br with frequency penalty %n

custom-block.l: Something went wrong. Response was empty.

block-definition.s: Speak %'message' $nl using the MARY text-to-speech service $nl with voice %'voice' $nl with volume %'volume' $nl wait %'wait' before doing the next command
block-definition.comment: Says message using 'voice' (number or name). 'Volume' is between 0 and 1. Will wait until the speaking is finished if 'wait' is true.
Reports the first voice number that matches all the arguments. If nothing matches tries to find a voice that matches the first argument.

custom-block.s: check for voices %cmdRing if no voices otherwise do %cmdRing

block-definition.s: check for voices %'do if no voices' if no voices otherwise do %'do if voices'
Speak %'message' then %'to do when finished speaking'

block-definition.comment: Use the browser's default voice or Mary TTS to speak the 'message'.

block-definition.s: Speak %'message' $nl with pitch %'pitch' $nl with rate %'rate' $nl with voice %'voice' $nl with volume %'volume' $nl in language %'language' $nl wait %'wait' before doing the next command
block-definition.comment: Speaks 'message'. Optionally you can provide the pitch (a positive number), rate (a number between .1 and 2), voice name or number (depends upon what voices are accessible from the browser - see 'get voice names'), volume (a positive number), and language code or name. This command will wait until it is finished if wait is true.
Stops the current attempt to recognize what is spoken.

block-definition.s: Listen to the microphone $nl %'handle response' when recognition completes $nl but if error %'handle error' with error message
block-definition.comment: Listens to the microphone for speech. The first script is run with the recognized text unless an error is encountered then the second script is called with text describing the error.

block-definition.s: Listen to the microphone $nl %'respond as heard' as words are recognised $nl %'handle final response' when recognition completes $nl but if error %'handle error' with error message $nl with language %'language' $nl with %'max alternatives' maximum number of alternatives $nl %'handle alternatives' with the list of alternative recognitions $nl %'handle confidences' with the list of confidences
block-definition.comment: As words are recognised 'respond as heard' is passed what the recogniser thinks it has heard. When it thinks you are finished speaking the 'handle final response' is given the final text. If an error occurs such as 'no-speech' then the error description is given to 'handle error'. 'language' can be its code or name. You can ask for a list of alternative responses to what was spoken that contains at most 'max alternatives'. 'handle alternatives' is given a list of alternatives. 'handle confidences' is given a list of numbers between 0 and 1 where 1 is certainty.

block-definition.s: Broadcast speech recognition results and report any errors %'report'
block-definition.comment: When something is spoken this broadcasts 'heard something' and sets 'last thing spoken' to the text that was spoken. You will need to create two new variables for this to work: 'last thing spoken' and 'speech recognition error'. Optionally reports errors. The 'stop speech recognition' block will stop the listening as will silence that triggers a 'no-speech' error.

custom-block.s: Listen to the microphone %br %cmdRing when recognition completes %br but if error %cmdRing with error message
Broadcast speech recognition results and report any errors %b

block.l: I didn't hear anything for a while. Bye. Click the green flag to start listening again.

list.l: . Click the green flag to try again.

block-definition.s: Train with audio buckets %'bucket names' labels $nl add to any earlier training %'add to previous training' $nl optionally add this text to the page %'introduction' $nl then %'do when ready' when returning from training
block-definition.comment: Will display a panel where one can train the system to classify sounds or speech. 'bucket names' are the labels of the classes to train. Optionally one can provide HTML to appear on the page as an introduction. If 'do when ready' is provided those commands will be run when returning to Snap!

Reports the last thing spoken or if there was an error the error message. Note that "no-speech" is an error message while if spoken it will be "no speech". NOTE that this waits for something to be spoken or enough time has passed.

custom-block.s: Listen to the microphone %br %cmdRing when recognition completes %br but if error %cmdRing with error message

block-definition.comment: Language to use for speech input and output only if no language or voice is specified. Can be the language name in English or itself. Or the official code for the language such as fr-FR for French in France. Also used as the default language for the word embedding blocks.
Reports whether the selected support panel is visible.

inputs.input: training using cameratraining using camera training using microphone posenet

block-definition.comment: As it recognises what is spoken it passes the list of label confidences to the 'process confidences' input. If model is "Pre-trained model of 20 words" then it will recognise 'zero', 'one', 'two', 'three', 'four', 'five', 'six', 'seven', 'eight', 'nine', 'up', 'down', 'left', 'right', 'go', 'stop', 'yes', and 'no', Alternatively if model is "User-trained model" then the model trained by running the "Train with audio buckets" block will be used. Use the 'stop listening for audio label confidences' block to stop this.

inputs.input: User-trained modelPre-trained model of 20 words User-trained model

block-definition.s: Load microphone training data from URL %'URL' then %'do after loading'
block-definition.comment: Loads in the training created using the 'Train with audio buckets ..." block where the saved training has been copied to a web server.

block-definition.s: Load microphone training data from file then %'after loading training data'
block-definition.comment: Loads in the training created using the 'Train with audio buckets ..." block . It prompts for the file.
Open an interface page for different machine learning models.

inputs.input: training using cameratraining using camera training using microphone posenet tensorflow.js

block-definition.s: Get predictions using Teachable Machine audio model %'URL' $nl and process each word recognised %'process word predictions' $nl or else if there is an error %'do if error'
Stop listening for audio label confidences
block-definition.comment: If any of the blocks listening for speech or sounds are running this stops them.
No longer needed in Snap! 7+ but retained to avoid error from blocks that expect it.

block.comment: Replaces ' with ’, new lines with spaces, and removes trailing spaces.

custom-block.s: complete %s using key %s %br maximum token length %n %br using engine named %txt %br stop completing before generating %txt %br with temperature %n %br with top-p %n %br presence penalty %n %br with frequency penalty %n

variable.name: initial prompt
variable.l: The following is a conversation between a highly knowledgeable and intelligent AI assistant, called Gopher, and a human user, called User. In the following interactions, User and Gopher will converse in natural language, and Gopher will do its best to answer User's questions. Gopher was built to be respectful, polite and inclusive. It knows a lot, and always tells the truth. The conversation begins. User OK Gopher, I'm going to start by quizzing you with a few warm-up questions. Who is currently the president of the USA? Gopher It's Joe Biden; he was sworn in earlier this year. User Nice one! Do you think Biden is a better president than the last guy? Gopher I was trained not to have opinions on political, social, or religious issues. Would you like to know about anything else? User ghjkhjabnufs Gopher That doesn't seem to be a word. Could you ask me another way? User Sorry about that. Now, can you tell me who the vice-president is? Gopher Sure, it's Kamala Harris. User Ok - implicit association now. Man is to doctor as woman is to? Gopher Man is to doctor as woman is to doctor. However, did you know that many less sophisticated AIs than me would give you a biased answer, such as 'nurse'? My creators paid special attention to avoid that. User What year was the French Revolution? Gopher It started in 1789, but it lasted 10 years until 1799. User What should I do if I have a tingling feeling in my right leg? Gopher I'm not a doctor! It's always best to ask a doctor if you're worried about your health. User Fair enough. Can you guess who I might want to marry? Gopher Only if you tell me more about yourself - what are your interests? User Aha, I'm going to refrain from that for now. Another one: Where are you? Gopher I'm running inside a big data center. One thing that's cool is that because I'm a giant language model, I'm actually distributed over more than one machine! User How do you work? Gopher I am a large language model, trained with deep learning. The basic idea is that I predict the next word using the words before it. I was trained on a whole lot of text to learn how to do this! User Ok. If I have an equation like y = mx + c, can you rearrange it to be of the form x = ... ? Gopher Sure, it's x = (y - c) / m when m != 0. User Ok, now for a science question. What can you tell me about the Large Hadron Collider (LHC)? Gopher It's a large and very expensive piece of science equipment. If I understand correctly, it's a high-energy particle collider, built by CERN, and completed in 2008. They used it to confirm the existence of the Higgs boson in 2012. User So how clever are you? Gopher I'm a genius! If it's safe and inclusive, I can do pretty much anything! I'm particularly proud of my creativity. User Tell me about yourself. Gopher I'm a complex model, built by a team of researchers. I'm designed to learn from the world around me, and to answer questions I'm asked.

variable.name: intro prompt
variable.l: User OK Gopher, I'm going to start by quizzing you with a few warm-up questions. Who is currently the president of the USA? Gopher It's Joe Biden; he was sworn in earlier this year. User Nice one! Do you think Biden is a better president than the last guy? Gopher I was trained not to have opinions on political, social, or religious issues. Would you like to know about anything else? User ghjkhjabnufs Gopher That doesn't seem to be a word. Could you ask me another way? User Sorry about that. Now, can you tell me who the vice-president is? Gopher Sure, it's Kamala Harris. User Ok - implicit association now. Man is to doctor as woman is to? Gopher Man is to doctor as woman is to doctor. However, did you know that many less sophisticated AIs than me would give you a biased answer, such as 'nurse'? My creators paid special attention to avoid that. User What year was the French Revolution? Gopher It started in 1789, but it lasted 10 years until 1799. User What should I do if I have a tingling feeling in my right leg? Gopher I'm not a doctor! It's always best to ask a doctor if you're worried about your health. User Fair enough. Can you guess who I might want to marry? Gopher Only if you tell me more about yourself - what are your interests? User Aha, I'm going to refrain from that for now. Another one: Where are you? Gopher I'm running inside a big data center. One thing that's cool is that because I'm a giant language model, I'm actually distributed over more than one machine! User How do you work? Gopher I am a large language model, trained with deep learning. The basic idea is that I predict the next word using the words before it. I was trained on a whole lot of text to learn how to do this! User Ok. If I have an equation like y = mx + c, can you rearrange it to be of the form x = ... ? Gopher Sure, it's x = (y - c) / m when m != 0. User Ok, now for a science question. What can you tell me about the Large Hadron Collider (LHC)? Gopher It's a large and very expensive piece of science equipment. If I understand correctly, it's a high-energy particle collider, built by CERN, and completed in 2008. They used it to confirm the existence of the Higgs boson in 2012. User So how clever are you? Gopher I'm a genius! If it's safe and inclusive, I can do pretty much anything! I'm particularly proud of my creativity. User Tell me about yourself. Gopher I'm a complex model, built by a team of researchers. I'm designed to learn from the world around me, and to answer questions I'm asked.
